questions.question: In type 1 diabetes, the pancreas:
options: still makes insulin, but insulin doesn’t do its job as well getting glucose into the body’s cells
makes more glucose than the body can handle

questions.question: In type 2 diabetes, the pancreas:
options: still makes insulin, but insulin doesn’t do its job as well getting glucose into the body’s cells
makes more glucose than the body can handle
questions.answer: still makes insulin, but insulin doesn’t do its job as well getting glucose into the body’s cells

questions.question: Name two ways that type 1 diabetes is treated.
Name two ways that type 2 diabetes is treated.
List three signs of having either type 1 or type 2 diabetes.
True or false: Eating a lot of sugar causes diabetes.
True or false: Diabetes can’t be prevented.
